Sentencas: High temperature co-electrolysis of H2O/CO2 allows for clean production of syngas using renewable energy, and the novel fuel-assisted electrolysis can effectively reduce consumption of electricity.
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Here, we report on symmetric cells YSZ-LSCrF vertical bar YSZ vertical bar YSZ-LSCrF, impregnated with Ni-SDC catalysts, for CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O/CO2.
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The required voltages to achieve an electrolysis current density of -400 mA.cm(-2) at 850 degrees C are 1.0 V for the conventional co-electrolysis and 0.3 V for the CH4-assisted co-electrolysis, indicative of a 70% reduction in the electricity consumption.
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: For an inlet of H2O/CO2 (50/50 vol), syngas with a H-2:CO ratio of approximate to 2 can be always produced from the cathode under different current densities.
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: In contrast, the anode effluent strongly depends upon the electrolysis current density and the operating temperature, with syngas favorably produced under moderate current densities at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: It is demonstrated that syngas with a H-2:CO ratio of approximate to 2 can be produced from the anode at a formation rate of 6.5.mL min(-1).cm(-2) when operated at 850 degrees C with an electrolysis current density of -450 mA.cm(-2).
Titulo: Syngas production through CH4-assisted co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in La0.8Sr0.2Cr0.5Fe0.5O3-δZr0.84Y0.16O2-δ electrode-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells
